posts.title: Alligoria
posts.excerpt: SUMMARY The film recalls various periods of Greece’s history. Sfikas studies and interprets the artistic movements of his time, influenced by eighties Post-Modernism. Starting in antiquity, he passes through the Byzantine and feudal eras and ends up in capitalism, without proposing this as a final end. Following the spire of this development, Sfikas resorts to …

posts.title: Prikosnoveniye
posts.excerpt: MDB: Nice and sad Fairytale I was pretty surprised to see this rare Kazach film. First of all it touches upon great Asian folk atmosphere and has wonderful music, partly composed by master of soviet electronic music Edward Artemeyev. The director shows great visionary in the film. Some parts of the film are made in …

posts._title: Chris Marker – Lettre de Sibérie AKA Letter from Siberia (1957) (HD)
posts.title: Lettre de Sibérie
posts.excerpt: Review from senses of cinema: Pick any recent book on documentary and you’re likely to find mention of Chris Marker’s oeuvre, usually characterising him as an essayist or even perhaps a poetic ethnographer. While there is some truth to this what most commentators have avoided recognising is Marker’s chameleon-like shift from photography to film, film …

posts._title: Guðmundur Arnar Guðmundsson – Hjartasteinn AKA Heartstone (2016)
posts.title: Hjartasteinn
posts.excerpt: Quote: A remote fishing village in Iceland. Teenage boys Thor and Christian experience a turbulent summer as one tries to win the heart of a girl while the other discovers new feelings toward his best friend. When summer ends and the harsh nature of Iceland takes back its rights, it’s time to leave the playground …

posts.title: Night Awake
posts.excerpt: Quote: Night Awake is an experimental noise film provoking 3rd eye (seeing what is inside beyond the limit of symbols) opening with image and sound. By transferring camera into a spiritual medium, the lunar god has taught messages in the gap of time. The film is from the graveyard, and it is a textile of …

posts._title: Naomi Kawase – Mogari no mori AKA The Mourning Forest (2007)
posts.title: Mogari no mori
posts.excerpt: Quote: A care-giver at a small retirement home takes one of her patients for a drive to the country, but the two wind up stranded in a forest where they embark on an exhausting and enlightening two-day journey.

posts.title: Strange Beasts
posts.excerpt: Strange Beasts” is an augmented reality game. It allows you to create and grow your own virtual pet.

posts._title: Robert Kramer – Sous le vent AKA Leeward (1991)
posts.title: Sous le vent
posts.excerpt: Quote: The film is part of the television series “La culture en chantiers” (“Culture under Construction”). In the form of a video letter, this film goes up the Seine. Starting with the traces of the Normandy landing of the Americans, it ends in Paris in Jean Genet’s hotel room. It is a voyage made to …

posts.title: Paulina Hollers
posts.excerpt: Quote: A religious zealot mother kills herself to try and find her dead son and escape with him from Hell. Music by Jim Becker and filmmaker Brent Green.

posts.title: The Narrow World
posts.excerpt: A giant alien creature comes to Earth. The reasons for its arrival, however, remain unknown as mankind fails to make contact with the visitor. Review: The Narrow World follows a group of scientists as they try to unravel the enigma of the alien’s purpose. That setup may have the sound of a schlocky ‘alien invasion’ …
